channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Malnutrition in Gaza at alarming levels, WHO warns as aid airdrops resume
item.description: Israel's concessions to aid come as it faces growing international pressure to alleviate mass starvation in Gaza.

item.title: Bowen: Israel's aid measures a gesture to allies horrified by Gaza starvation
item.description: This might be a tacit admission by the Israelis that they need to do more - but more likely the measures are a response to allies.

item.title: Gaza air drops 'a grotesque distraction', aid agencies warn
item.description: Several aid groups say dropping food from the air onto densely populated Gaza is a risk to civilian lives.

item.title: 'We need a real solution': Gazans welcome aid plan but fear it will not end crisis
item.description: Israel says aid convoys will be allowed into Gaza, after weeks of mounting pressure and warnings of starvation.

item.title: Israel intercepts Gaza-bound activist boat carrying food aid
item.description: Pro-Palestinian group Freedom Flotilla Coalition says the vessel was trying to bring food aid to Gaza.

item.title: Gaza aid site offered a 'women only' day. It didn't stop the killing
item.description: Families say mothers Mary Sheikh al-Eid and Khadija Abu Anza were shot while seeking aid from GHF station in southern Gaza.

item.title: Almost a third of people in Gaza not eating for days, UN food programme warns
item.description: Israel faces increasing pressure from Western allies to lift restrictions into the flow of aid into Gaza.

item.title: France will recognise Palestinian state, Macron says
item.description: France to become the first G7 state to recognise the state of Palestine, as Israeli PM Netanyahu condemns decision.

item.title: Trump says Hamas 'didn't want deal' as US and Israel leave Gaza talks
item.description: Hamas expresses "surprise" after US envoy Steve Witkoff also accuses the group of showing "a lack of desire to reach a ceasefire".

item.title: One in five children in Gaza City is malnourished, UN aid agency says
item.description: The UN agency for Palestinians says it has thousands of truckloads of supplies near Gaza which it wants to deliver.

item.title: 'I can barely do one story. I just feel dizzy' - BBC's Gaza freelance journalists tell of struggle for food
item.description: Three freelance journalists working for the BBC in Gaza are facing the same dire circumstances as those they are covering.

item.title: Gazans 'wasting away' as mass starvation spreads, humanitarian groups warn
item.description: A joint statement says the Israeli government's "siege" has left aid supplies "totally depleted".

item.title: Church leaders return with 'broken hearts' after rare visit to Gaza
item.description: The Latin and Greek Orthodox patriarchs of Jerusalem describing starving people not "batting an eyelid" at the sound of bombing.

item.title: Gaza war: Is the UK selling arms to Israel?
item.description: The UK suspended dozens of arms licences to Israel last year, but many say the measures do not go far enough.

item.title: Gaza health ministry says 33 people died from malnutrition in 48 hours
item.description: Fifteen deaths have been reported over the past day, the Hamas-run ministry says, as the UN warns of "soaring" malnutrition.

item.title: Bedouins tell BBC they could return to fighting Druze in Syria
item.description: More than 1,000 people in Syria have been killed in recent clashes between Bedouin and Druze fighters.

item.title: He went to get aid and didn't come back - stories of people killed in Gaza
item.description: As aid agencies warn of "mass starvation", the BBC hears from the relatives of some of those killed in the past week.

item.title: We might get killed, but we have to get food, injured Gazan tells BBC
item.description: Many patients brought to UK-Med's Gaza field hospital were seeking food aid but found only violence.

item.title: Iran's detainees in 'unbearable' conditions after Israeli strikes on prison
item.description: Iranian prisoners transferred to other facilities report overcrowding and unhygienic conditions.

item.title: The Today Debate: What can stop the war in Gaza
item.description: BBC Radio 4's Today programme presenter Nick Robinson discusses what can be done to stop the war in Gaza, with a panel of experts and politicians.

item.title: 'They shot patients in beds' â€“ BBC hears claims of massacre at Suweida hospital
item.description: The BBC visits Suweida's National Hospital where staff claim patients were killed by Syrian government forces.

item.title: Jeremy Bowen: Israel's allies see evidence of war crimes in Gaza mounting up
item.description: The Middle East has been transformed since 7 October, and almost two years on, the conflict in Gaza is at another inflection point.

item.title: BBC sees fragile ceasefire holding in Syria's battle-scarred Suweida province
item.description: Sectarian clashes between Druze fighters and Bedouin militia began in the southern Syrian province about 10 days ago.

item.title: Who are the Druze and why is Israel attacking Syria?
item.description: Syria is being rocked by a fresh wave of deadly sectarian violence, highlighting its fragile security landscape.

item.title: 'They were just kids': Mother mourns sons killed in Israeli strike while waiting for aid
item.description: Two of Iman al-Nouri's five sons were killed outside a clinic in Deir al-Balah on Thursday, while a third was seriously wounded.

item.title: Outrage builds over plan to force all Gazans to southern city
item.description: Critics denounce a plan by Israel's defence minister to relocate all Palestinians in Gaza to a small area in the south.

item.title: 'I'm so tired': Mother of starving Gazan baby speaks to BBC
item.description: Hedaya al-Muta'wi's 18-month-old son Mohammed suffers from malnutrition due to famine, weighing just 6kg.

item.title: 'I witnessed war crimes' in Gaza, former worker at GHF aid site tells BBC
item.description: A retired US soldier reveals why he quit working at Israel and US-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation aid hubs.

item.title: Watch: Protesters pack Tel Aviv square to demand Gaza ceasefire
item.description: Demonstrators urged Isreal's leaders to end the war and bring back the hostages.

item.title: 'All the people are hungry': Voices from Gaza on desperate lack of food
item.description: All week across the BBC we've been hearing from people in Gaza about their lives as food supplies are restricted leading to malnourishment and starvation.

item.title: Watch: At the final checkpoint before the 'dangerous' road to Suweida city
item.description: Government forces say it is too dangerous for journalists and aid trucks to enter Suweida city.
